newsitem.title: HONG KONG: COSCO Pac ports throughput up in early 97.
newsitem.headline: COSCO Pac ports throughput up in early 97.

text.p: COSCO Pacific Ltd said on Thursday throughput at its terminals in Hong Kong and China posted significant growth in the first four months in 1997.
"Our terminal business is very encouraging this year," said Zhang Dachun, COSCO Pacific's vice chairman.

Throughput of Hong Kong's Container Terminal Eight (East) was 387,900 TEU (20-foot equivalent units) in the first four months to April, up 29 percent from the same period a year earlier, he told a news conference.
"We are confident that the terminal can achieve our target of 1.3 million containers this year," Zhang said.
COSCO has a 50 percent stake in Terminal Eight (East).

Earlier this year, the company purchased a 50 percent stake in Qingdao Terminal, a 51 percent stake in Zhangjiagang Terminal, a 10 percent stake in Shanghai Terminal and a five percent stake in Yantian Terminal.
Throughputs of its Chinese ports rose sharply in the period from January to April this year compared with the first four months in 1996, Zhang said.
Yantian handled 125 percent more containers over that period to 159,817 boxes and Shanghai Terminal 509,707 containers, up 19.6 percent.
Qingdao Terminal handled 100,060 TEU, up 44.6 percent and Zhangjiagang's throughput increased 10 percent to 35,917 TEU in January to April.
On the container leasing front, rents were generally steady, Zhang said.
